name: Who Likes A Challenge? Online Trivia | Mixed 15 Questions | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which film star was born in Beirut, Lebanon and his first name means 'Cool breeze over the mountains' in Hawaiian?
What was Welsh film star Richard Burton's last film before his death on 5th August 1984?
Which have teeth, a frog or a toad?
How many books did romance novelist Dame Barbara Cartland write?
questions.explanation:
723.

	Her books were translated into 36 languages. She was the step-grandmother to the late Princess Diana.

questions.text: Where in Oklahoma, USA, was the film director Ron Howard born on 1st March 1954?
In which city would you see the famous Atomium?
questions.explanation:
Brussels.

	102 metres high, model of an iron crystal molecule, built to celebrate the 1958 International Exhibition.

questions.text: What is Jane Fonda's middle name?
Who is known as 'Gwiazdor' in Poland?
questions.explanation:
Santa Claus.

	It means 'Star Man' from the North Star.

questions.text: Where would you find the 'Haversian Canals'?
questions.explanation:
In Your Bones.

	Any of the channels that form a network in bone and contain blood vessels and nerves. Named after C. Havers, an English anatomist who discovered them.

questions.text: Who was born Terry Bollea on August 11th 1953?
Three famous horror movie stars were born on either May 26th or May 27th. Which horror movie actor does not fit into either of these dates?
questions.explanation:
Bela Lugosi.

	Peter Cushing born May 26th 1913. Christopher Lee born May 27th 1922. Vincent Price born May 27th 1911.

questions.text: Which month is named after the Roman Goddess of Growth?
questions.explanation:
May.

	Although there is some obscurity surrounding the actual Maia that May is named after, the most accepted one is Maia, the mother of Mercury.

questions.text: Pure quartz consists of only two elements; Silicon and ... ?

options: A Sailor who has crossed the Equator

questions.text: Who is the Roman Goddess of flocks and shepherds?
questions.explanation:
Pales.

	Own up, how many said 'Pan', the Greek God of Pastures, Forests, Flocks and Herds.
